intro: Campanula argentea, commonly known as silver bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in rocky or limestone habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Campanula argentea is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
